pullRequest.title: Alpha Scan Rule: Cross-Origin Resource Policy Header
pullRequest.bodyText:
Help enforce CORP header. Should be same-origin or cross-origin
Raise an alert when CORP header is missing, invalid
or set to same-site

This header helps mitigate side-channels attacks as Spectre.
It is complementary with CORB, COEP and COOP.
Next steps will be to add a consistent alert for missing COOP/COEP header.
Checklist:

 CORP: Alert if header "Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy" is missing or invalid for any resource
 CORP: Alert if header is Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy: same-site"
 COEP: Alert if "Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy" or "Access-Control-Allow-Origin" is missing or invalid for any document
 COOP: Alert if "Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy" is missing for any document

Out-of-scope:

CORB: Enforces that  the header is set to"X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff" with "Content-Type"

Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy Scan Rule

+Spectre is a side-channel attack allowing an attacker to read data +from memory. One of the counter-measure is to prevent sensitive data +to enter the memory. +
+ The Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy (CORP) header allows you + to control the set of origins that are empowered to include + a resource. It is a robust defense against attacks like Spectre, + as it allows browsers to block a given response before it enters + an attacker's process. +
+For example, an attacker site can include a image tag with an attribute +src to an internal content. The browser will load the data. With a +side-channel attack, an attacker will be able to read it. + +CORP is complementary of CORB and COOP. +

+ The Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy (CORP) header allows you + to control the set of origins that are empowered to include + a resource. It is a robust defense against attacks like Spectre, + as it allows browsers to block a given response before it enters + an attacker's process. +
